title: 2021–22 Independence Cup (Bangladesh)
text:
The 2021 Independence Cup was the 11th edition of the <a href="Independence%20Cup%20%28Bangladesh%29">Independence Cup</a>, the main domestic annual top tier clubs <a href="Association%20football">football</a> tournament organized by <a href="Bangladesh%20Football%20Federation">Bangladesh Football Federation</a> (BFF). The fifteen participants were competed this edition in the tournament.
<a href="Dhaka%20Abahani">Dhaka Abahani</a> is the defending champion, having defeated 3–0 goals <a href="Bashundhara%20Kings">Bashundhara Kings</a> in the final of the tournament.
Participating teams.
The following fifteen teams will contest in the tournament.
Venue.
All matches was held at <a href="Bir%20Sherestha%20Shaheed%20Shipahi%20Mostafa%20Kamal%20Stadium">BSSS Mostafa Kamal Stadium</a> in <a href="Dhaka">Dhaka</a>, Bangladesh.
Draw.
The draw ceremony of the tournament was held on 23 November 2021 15:00 at 3rd floors of BFF house <a href="Motijheel">Motijheel</a>, Dhaka, Bangladesh. There are fifteen teams were divided into four groups. Top two team's from each group will through <a href="%23Knockout%20stage">Knockout stage</a>.
Group stages.
Teams were ranked according to <a href="Points%20%28association%20football%29">points</a> (3 points for a win, 1 point for a draw, 0 points for a loss), and if tied on points, the following tie-breaking criteria were applied, in the order given, to determine the rankings.
